Watches the fight with fear initially but seizes the opportunity to regain his powers when a Crony slams into Vlad, showing situational awareness and quick reaction.
Joins the renewed fight with Mavis with reinvigorated energy, indicating teamwork and effective response to changing circumstances.
Initially passive and watching with fear instead of intervening when Mavis and Johnny are grabbed, indicating hesitation or lack of immediate action.
Runs to Dennis and Mavis, hugs Dennis, sheds a tear, and expresses that he doesn’t care about Dennis being a vampire, only that he is his grandson.
Admits to Mavis that both were wrong to try to tell Dennis who he was instead of letting him find out for himself.
Sarcastically mutters self-deprecating comment about being wrong.
Joins the fight against the cronies as a bat, showing willingness to engage and contribute to the defense of the hotel.
Expresses unconditional love and acceptance for Dennis regardless of his identity, prioritizing family over labels.
Admits fault in trying to tell Dennis who he was instead of allowing him to discover it himself, showing self-awareness and emotional intelligence.
Sarcastically mutters 'Yes. Only I was wrong,' indicating a potentially stubborn or defensive attitude, which could hinder constructive communication.
Responds to Vlad's praise of the hotel and family unity with a dismissive 'Yeah, what about it?' showing possible reluctance or defensiveness despite success.
Cheers for monsters and humans together, promoting unity.
